page.title: 01Crynant, West Glamorgan
page.content: Crynant is a village situated in the Dulais Valley approximately six miles north of the town of Neath. The name 'Dulais' seems to be a fairly common name for a river and is formed from 'du' which is Welsh for black, and 'glais' which means stream, hence the 'black stream'. According to local historians the more common spelling of Crynant is a mis-spelling of the Welsh{Creunant} where the Welsh -eu- is given an English y-sound. It is a compound word made from 'crau'+'nant' where the latter means 'brook' but the former 'crau' could possibly mean 'bloody' or 'sty,stockade'. Although the postal address of the village reads{Crynant}the primary school has the title of{Creunant {Primary School. {
